Davon sind @Lambo (Leiter des @tibosl) & Koautor @hauschke (Leiter der Lab-Gruppe Offene #Forschungsinformationen) überzeugt. The truly disturbing thing about this particular story is that a molar pregnancy is not a pregnancy at all. Once it is diagnosed, there is no blastocyst, embryo, or fetus involved at all, only a tumor, sometimes malignant, that will grow unchecked and can kill the pregnant person as it does. Treating molar pregnancy isn’t an abortion any more than treating uterine cancer is.

title: A ~5 minute guide to Numba — Numba 0.56.4+0.g288a38bbd.dirty-py3.7-linux-x86_64.egg documentation

last_post.content:
Hello - an #introductorytoot!

Numba is an open-source JIT Compiler for Python. It translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into optimized machine code for CPUs and CUDA using LLVM.

Installable with conda / pip:

conda install numba
pip install numba

Get started with the 5 minute guide: https://numba.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/5minguide.html

Code is on Github: https://github.com/numba/numba

Start developing / contributing with the development guide: https://numba.readthedocs.io/en/stable/developer/index.html

Get help on Discourse: https://numba.disourse.group

A Rails session_store cookie domain can be set to `:all`, ie the Domain is set to `x.com` so the session cookie is sent on requests to `app.x.com`, `foo.x.com` etc

Thats often suggested for when you want to allow a user to be authenticated across subdomains

But don't forget you might be using CNAMEs to map 3rd party services to a subdomain (eg a 3rd party analytics on `track.x.com`)

The session cookies will go to those too. https://seclab.bu.edu/papers/cname_cloaking-asiaccs2021.pdf

So if you are using `:all`, one to remember

Moved to a #Calckey or #Misskey instance and missing watching #Hashtags? Well do I have something for you!!

Antennas.
Antennas are effectively custom timelines. They work approximately like watching hashtags, but they can look for normal text as well. You can add as many phrases as you like and the results can be filtered with an ignore list.

You can make an antenna that just shows posts from specific users and notifies you when they post something new, you can make an antenna that collects posts containing or excluding certain key words, or you can make an antenna that collects only posts with files attached. You can even make an antenna consisting of “Posts from specific users” with “Show replies” checked.

Setting up
You can set up antenna by going to the More! section on your sidebar, and selecting Antennas. Press Add + to create your first. This is where you can also manage & edit previously created antennas.

Images:
1) Where to find More! on the sidebar (highlighted)
2) Where to find Antennas in the More! menu (highlighted)
3) My antennas page showing *Add +* button and my previously created antennas.
4 & 5) When you click Add + you get this page to set up your antenna. I've set one up as my Calckey antenna and another to alert me when PastaThief posts. There's a lot to go through here. Expect a separate post sometime soon.
6 & 7) What those antenna feeds look like.
8) On our progressive web app you can access your antennas by selecting the UFO in the top right corner.
9) Clicking on the UFO button brings up all my antennas and the link to manage/edit them

#Mastodon #Fediverse #Feditips #calckeytutorial


I plan on writing up a fuller explanation soon, but happy in the meantime to help anyone wanting to set them up.
